Zahi Hawass , reached by phone early Monday, dismissed such claims as being exaggerated. The damage at Saqqara is not really much. I'm not worried at all. Everything is going to be safe today and tomorrow the situation will be finished, said Zahi Hawass , also a National Geographic Society explorer-in-residence.( The National Geographic Society owns National Geographic Society News.) standing by Gabrielle Giffords ' hospital bed when her left eye fluttered open. Her right eye was damaged and is still bandaged.` PROUD OF HER' Kirsten Gillibrand told reporters the congresswomen were telling Gabrielle Giffords how proud we were of her and how she was inspiring the whole nation with her courage and with her strength. And then Debbie Wasserman Schultz and I started joking about all the things we were going to do after she got better. Gabrielle Giffords was gripping their hands, Kirsten Gillibrand said,`` and the more we joked about what we were going to do, she started to open her eyes.''
